extendedIngredients.name: broccoli rabe
extendedIngredients.original: 4 bunches broccoli rabe (rapini), divided into 8 sections

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided plus more for coating potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalName: olive oil, divided plus more for coating potatoes

extendedIngredients.name: potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 6 to 8 white potatoes, scrubbed and cut into chunks
extendedIngredients.originalName: to 8 white potatoes, scrubbed and cut into chunks

extendedIngredients.name: roma tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 8 Roma plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise and seeds removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: Roma plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise and seeds removed

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: shallots
extendedIngredients.original: 2 finely diced shallots, or 1 white onion, finely diced

title: Chicken Stuffed with Smoked Mozzarella, Roasted Tomatoes and Broccoli Rabe over Potatoes with Marsala Sauce
summary: Chicken Stuffed with Smoked Mozzarella, Roasted Tomatoes and Broccoli Rabe over Potatoes with Marsala Sauce is a gluten free recipe with 8 servings. One portion of this dish contains about 20g of protein, 33g of fat, and a total of 616 calories. For $3.3 per serving, this recipe covers 34% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Foodnetwork has 66 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 2 hours and 20 minutes. It works well as a side dish. If you have shallots, chicken breasts, vegetable stock, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. Overall, this recipe earns a spectacular spoonacular score of 86%. Chicken Stuffed with Smoked Mozzarella, Roasted Tomatoes and Broccoli Rabe over Potatoes with Marsala Sauce, Baked Spaghetti Frittata With Broccoli Rabe And Smoked Mozzarella, and Dinner Tonight: Broccoli Rabe, Roasted Red Pepper, Mozzarella are very similar to this recipe.
instructions: To roast vegetables, preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place tomatoes and rapini on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper and coat with 1/4 cup of the olive oil. Roast the vegetables until tender, then remove and allow to cool.                          Begin the Marsala sauce by heating 1/4 cup of the oil in a saute pan and cooking the shallots or onion gently until translucent. Deglaze the pan with the wine and add the stock and fresh thyme. Allow to reduce by 2/3.                          For the stuffed chicken, preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lay a long piece of plastic wrap over your cutting board and tuck it underneath the sides of the board. The chicken breasts should be placed on the covered cutting board, skin side down, with enough space between them so they can lay flat after you "butterfly" them. To make the butterfly cut, carefully slice open (without slicing the chicken all the way through) and spread the flesh of the chicken out so you will be able to pound it out into a single thin piece on which you will place stuffing and then roll up. Season the breasts with salt and pepper. Then put another length of plastic wrap over the seasoned chicken breasts and flatten with meat mallet to integrate the seasoning into the chicken. (Covering the chicken with the plastic will also keep the mess down when you pound with the meat mallet.) Pound chicken thin and remove plastic. Lay sliced smoked mozzarella on each breast followed by broccoli rabe and roasted tomatoes. Fold in each end and roll tightly, securing with toothpicks as needed, and placing on a baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper and brush with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Place in the oven and roast until fork tender about 45 to 50 minutes.                          Place the potatoes on a baking sheet, season with salt and pepper, and coat with olive oil. Place in the oven and roast potatoes until they are also fork tender.                          Strain Marsala sauce and whisk in butter to finish. Season with salt and pepper, as needed.                          Remove any toothpicks securing the chicken. Slice each chicken roll to reveal the stuffed interior. Place on serving plate with roasted potatoes. Spoon Marsala sauce around chicken. Garnish with chopped chives.

steps.step: To roast vegetables, preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place tomatoes and rapini on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper and coat with 1/4 cup of the olive oil. Roast the vegetables until tender, then remove and allow to cool.

Begin the Marsala sauce by heating 1/4 cup of the oil in a saute pan and cooking the shallots or onion gently until translucent. Deglaze the pan with the wine and add the stock and fresh thyme. Allow to reduce by 2/
For the stuffed chicken, preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

Lay a long piece of plastic wrap over your cutting board and tuck it underneath the sides of the board. The chicken breasts should be placed on the covered cutting board, skin side down, with enough space between them so they can lay flat after you "butterfly" them. To make the butterfly cut, carefully slice open (without slicing the chicken all the way through) and spread the flesh of the chicken out so you will be able to pound it out into a single thin piece on which you will place stuffing and then roll up. Season the breasts with salt and pepper. Then put another length of plastic wrap over the seasoned chicken breasts and flatten with meat mallet to integrate the seasoning into the chicken. (Covering the chicken with the plastic will also keep the mess down when you pound with the meat mallet.) Pound chicken thin and remove plastic.

Lay sliced smoked mozzarella on each breast followed by broccoli rabe and roasted tomatoes. Fold in each end and roll tightly, securing with toothpicks as needed, and placing on a baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper and brush with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Place in the oven and roast until fork tender about 45 to 50 minutes.
Place the potatoes on a baking sheet, season with salt and pepper, and coat with olive oil.
Place in the oven and roast potatoes until they are also fork tender.
Strain Marsala sauce and whisk in butter to finish. Season with salt and pepper, as needed.
Remove any toothpicks securing the chicken. Slice each chicken roll to reveal the stuffed interior.
Place on serving plate with roasted potatoes. Spoon Marsala sauce around chicken.
